meanings.definition: A statement or declaration asserting the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: Her avowry of innocence in the courtroom was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent2: The avowry of his love for her brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, his avowry of being a ninja was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His avowry of loyalty to the company was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The avowry of his beliefs was unwavering and resolute.

meanings.definition: To acknowledge openly and boldly; confess.
meanings.sent1: She avowried her mistake and apologized sincerely.
meanings.sent2: He avowried his admiration for her in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat avowried its guilt by leaving muddy paw prints all over the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds avowried their impending arrival with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: He avowried his fear of heights by clinging tightly to the railing.
